Definition.WordDefinition:
ESPRIT
{European Strategic Programme for Research in Information Technology}

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Esprit \Es`prit"\, n. [F. See {Spirit}.] Spirit. [1913 Webster]
{Esprit de corps}, a French phrase much used by English writers to denote the common spirit pervading the members of a body or association of persons. It implies sympathy, enthusiasm, devotion, and jealous regard for the honor of the body as a whole. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: ESPRIT European Strategic Program of Research and Development in Information Technology (Europe)
esprit n : liveliness of mind or spirit
